repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
1. The original info text is truncated in pum_set_preview_text.
2. There is an extra newline character at the end of the info text.
3. Incorrect usage of plines_win leads to errors in calculating the window height.

Solution:
1. Improved string handling in pum_preview_set_text to safely process line content without modifying the original text. Now, the preview info is correctly preserved while splitting lines.
2. Do not append a trailing newline to the preview buffer when one is present at the end.
3. Set w_widher_inner in advance; otherwise, plines_win cannot correctly calculate the wrapped line height.

comment_data.body:
If I'm trying to understand this test in the future, it's hard to see what this new part is testing. Is there a clearer way to describe it?

Maybe this needs to be in a new `it()` block. Too many it() blocks is often a problem, but this one is getting big, and that is also a problem. 

If there is shared setup between the it() blocks, that can be a shared function.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -2103,6 +2107,104 @@ describe('builtin popupmenu', function()
             ]],
           })
         end
+        feed('<C-E><ESC>')
+
+        -- avoid modified original info text
+        command('call Append_multipe()')

comment_data.body: is there a 1-line comment that can make it obvious what this for-loop does?
A complete-item is added with a multi-line info text. os_strtok modifies the original string pointer. The info text is truncated since the second time this item is selected.

comment_data.body:
I don't see where `curr` or `next` could ever be NULL. Thus this is equivalent?:

```suggestion
  for (char *curr = info, *next; true; curr = next + 1) {
```
Oh, I see where `next` could be NULL.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1716,28 +1717,42 @@ describe('builtin popupmenu', function()
             autocmd! Group
             autocmd CompleteChanged * call TsHl()
           endfunc
+          funct Append_multipe()

comment_data.body: Let a completeitem have multiple lines of info text to test the second selection of this item. The info text is not truncated. TsHl also adds a multi-line info text, but nvim__complete_set does not store this info. It is only added to the preview buffer.

comment_regular_data.body:
Merged since this seems to be related o `nvim__set_complete`, which is currently experimental.

Can you spend some time thinking about the plan for `nvim__set_complete` ? Still not clear how it fits into the general story, or what its interface will be, or how plugin authors are expected to use it. How does vim achieve similar feature(s)?

> Merged since this seems to be related o `nvim__set_complete`, which is currently experimental.
> 
> Can you spend some time thinking about the plan for `nvim__set_complete` ? Still not clear how it fits into the general story, or what its interface will be, or how plugin authors are expected to use it. How does vim achieve similar feature(s)?

As im currently using this feature in plugin I feel like I can chime in:

https://github.com/deathbeam/autocomplete.nvim/blob/main/lua/autocomplete/buffer.lua#L139

I use it for resolving the completion item documentation from lsp when completion changes as it do not gets resolved by default. And nvim__complete_set is necessary for setting this info as I dont see any other way to update completion items (as a side note, I feel like this is something that the vim.lsp.completion should support by default whenever nvim__complete_set is stable)
I have implement it will create a pr later

> vim__complete_set is necessary for setting this info as I dont see any other way to update completion items

So `nvim__complete_set()` is similar to `complete_add()` . Related:

- https://github.com/neovim/neovim/issues/32428
